intro: Diplostephium revolutum var. macrocephalum, commonly known as the giant cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon Basin. It is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are rich in nutrients, including high levels of antioxidants and healthy fats. It thrives in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Due to its unique morphology and nutritional value, it is of interest for both ecological and agricultural research.
